pensionable.translation[0].definitions[0: giving someone the right to receive a pension
36% of the population were of pensionable age.
pensionable.translation[1].definitions[0: having the right to receive a pension
We wish to encourage people to go on working after pensionable age (=the age at which they would normally receive a pension).
Donald retired at 56, after attaining the maximum pensionable service (=working enough years to get the highest possible pension) with an insurance company.
The Civil Service came to be thought of as a secure, pensionable occupation.
pensionable.translation[1].definitions[1: pay from which money is regularly taken to pay for a pension
The employeeâ€™s contribution is 5% of pensionable salary.
